channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: State-Aligned 'Shadow Campaign' Breaches Government & Critical Infrastructure in 37 Nations
item.description:
Headline: State-Aligned 'Shadow Campaign' Breaches Government & Critical Infrastructure in 37 Nations

Summary:
A sophisticated, state-aligned cyberespionage campaign, tracked as TGR-STA-1030, has successfully compromised at least 70 government and critical infrastructure organizations across 37 countries. The operation, dubbed the 'Shadow Campaign' by Palo Alto Networks, appears to be aligned with the strategic interests of the Chinese government, with attacks coinciding with major geopolitical and economic events. Targets include national law enforcement, finance ministries, and energy suppliers in nations like Brazil, Greece, and Taiwan. The attackers leverage phishing and unpatched vulnerabilities for initial access, focusing on stealing sensitive emails, financial data, and diplomatic communications, posing a significant long-term threat to global security.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A sophisticated state-aligned cyberespionage group (TGR-STA-1030) has compromised government and critical infrastructure targets in 37 countries in a massive 'Shadow Campaign' linked to China's geopolitical interests.

Article Slug: asian-apt-shadow-campaign-hits-governments-and-critical-infrastructure-in-37-countries

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA: Critical SmarterMail RCE Flaw Actively Exploited in Ransomware Attacks
item.description:
Headline: CISA: Critical SmarterMail RCE Flaw Actively Exploited in Ransomware Attacks

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in SmarterTools' SmarterMail, CVE-2026-24423, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 9.3, allows an unauthenticated attacker to take full control of a mail server by abusing an API method with a missing authentication check. CISA confirms the vulnerability is being actively used in ransomware campaigns and has mandated that federal agencies patch by February 26, 2026. All organizations using the affected email server software are strongly urged to update to build 9511 or later immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Ransomware, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: CISA adds critical RCE vulnerability CVE-2026-24423 in SmarterMail to its KEV catalog, warning of active exploitation in ransomware campaigns. Organizations are urged to patch immediately.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-smartermail-rce-flaw-in-ransomware-attacks

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive Data Leak: 8.7 Billion Records of Chinese Citizens Exposed on Unsecured Server
item.description:
Headline: Massive Data Leak: 8.7 Billion Records of Chinese Citizens Exposed on Unsecured Server

Summary:
A publicly accessible and unsecured Elasticsearch cluster has exposed a colossal 8.73 billion records containing highly sensitive personal information of Chinese citizens. Discovered by security researcher Bob Diachenko, the database was left open for over three weeks. The exposed data includes full names, national ID numbers, home addresses, mobile numbers, and, critically, plaintext passwords. The highly organized nature of the dataset suggests it was aggregated by a data broker or malicious actor, posing a severe and systemic risk of identity theft, financial fraud, and account takeovers for hundreds of millions of individuals across China.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: An unsecured Elasticsearch cluster exposed 8.7 billion records of Chinese citizens, including highly sensitive data like national ID numbers and plaintext passwords, creating a massive privacy and security crisis.

Article Slug: unsecured-elasticsearch-cluster-exposes-8-7-billion-chinese-citizen-records

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Issues Directive Forcing Removal of Unsupported Edge Devices from Federal Networks
item.description:
Headline: CISA Issues Directive Forcing Removal of Unsupported Edge Devices from Federal Networks

Summary:
In response to increasing exploitation by nation-state actors, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 26-02. The directive mandates that all Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies inventory and remove all unsupported network edge devices, such as firewalls and routers, within one year. Devices that are end-of-life (EOL) or end-of-support (EOS) no longer receive security updates and represent a significant risk. The order requires agencies to replace unsupported hardware and software, report their inventory to CISA, and establish a mature lifecycle management process to prevent future risks from technical debt.

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: CISA issues Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 26-02, mandating that U.S. federal agencies remove all unsupported and end-of-life network edge devices to reduce the attack surface exploited by cyber threat actors.

Article Slug: cisa-orders-federal-agencies-to-remove-unsupported-edge-devices-from-networks

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Betterment Data Breach Exposes 1.4M Customers After Social Engineering Attack
item.description:
Headline: Betterment Data Breach Exposes 1.4M Customers After Social Engineering Attack

Summary:
Automated investment platform Betterment has disclosed a data breach affecting 1.4 million customers, originating from a sophisticated social engineering attack. Threat actors, claiming to be the 'ShinyHunters' group, used voice phishing (vishing) to manipulate employees and steal Okta single sign-on codes, gaining access to third-party marketing and support systems. The compromised data includes names, email addresses, phone numbers, and physical addresses. While core financial accounts were not compromised, the attackers used the stolen contact information to launch a fraudulent cryptocurrency scam targeting Betterment's customers. The incident highlights the growing threat of social engineering targeting employees to bypass technical security controls.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Investment platform Betterment confirms a data breach affecting 1.4 million customers after a social engineering and voice phishing (vishing) attack allowed threat actors to access user PII.

Article Slug: betterment-data-breach-exposes-1-4-million-customers-after-social-engineering-attack

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Financial Sector Cyberattacks Doubled in 2025, Fueled by Geopolitical Hacktivism
item.description:
Headline: Financial Sector Cyberattacks Doubled in 2025, Fueled by Geopolitical Hacktivism

Summary:
A new report from Check Point Software reveals a dramatic escalation in cyber threats targeting the global financial sector, with incidents more than doubling in 2025. The primary driver was a 105% increase in Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks, which were largely motivated by geopolitically-driven hacktivism rather than direct financial gain. Hacktivist campaigns aimed to disrupt banking portals and payment systems in countries involved in geopolitical conflicts, including Israel, the U.S., and Ukraine. The report also highlights a 73% jump in data breaches and the persistent threat of multi-extortion ransomware, indicating a complex and evolving threat landscape for financial institutions.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A Check Point report finds that cyberattacks on the financial sector doubled in 2025, driven by a 105% increase in DDoS attacks from hacktivist groups with geopolitical motives.

Article Slug: financial-sector-cyberattacks-doubled-in-2025-fueled-by-hacktivism

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical RCE Flaw in n8n Automation Platform Allows Full Server Takeover
item.description:
Headline: Critical RCE Flaw in n8n Automation Platform Allows Full Server Takeover

Summary:
A critical sandbox escape vulnerability, CVE-2026-25049, has been discovered in the popular n8n workflow automation platform. The flaw, rated 9.4 on the CVSS scale, allows an authenticated user with permission to edit workflows to bypass security controls and execute arbitrary system commands on the host server. This could lead to a full server compromise, exposing sensitive credentials, API keys, and OAuth tokens stored in the environment. The vulnerability is a bypass for a previously patched RCE flaw, and administrators are urged to update to n8n versions 1.123.17 or 2.5.2 immediately to prevent potential hijacking of connected cloud services and AI pipelines.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A critical sandbox escape vulnerability (CVE-2026-25049) in the n8n workflow automation platform allows authenticated users to achieve remote code execution. Update to patched versions immediately.

Article Slug: critical-rce-vulnerability-in-n8n-automation-platform-allows-server-compromise

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Confirms Ransomware Actively Exploits VMware ESXi Sandbox Escape Flaw
item.description:
Headline: CISA Confirms Ransomware Actively Exploits VMware ESXi Sandbox Escape Flaw

Summary:
CISA has officially updated its KEV catalog to confirm that a high-severity sandbox escape vulnerability in VMware ESXi, CVE-2025-22225, is being actively exploited in ransomware attacks. The flaw, patched in March 2025, allows an attacker with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine to escape the sandbox and gain code execution on the underlying hypervisor. Research suggests the flaw is likely chained with two others (CVE-2025-22224 and CVE-2025-22226) and that an exploit toolkit may have existed a full year before the patch was released. CISA's confirmation underscores the urgent need for organizations to ensure their VMware environments are fully patched against these critical vulnerabilities.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Ransomware, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: CISA confirms that a high-severity VMware ESXi vulnerability, CVE-2025-22225, is being actively exploited in ransomware campaigns, urging organizations to apply patches from March 2025.

Article Slug: cisa-confirms-vmware-esxi-flaw-cve-2025-22225-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New 'Milkyway' Ransomware Strain Surfaces with Aggressive Extortion Tactics
item.description:
Headline: New 'Milkyway' Ransomware Strain Surfaces with Aggressive Extortion Tactics

Summary:
A new Windows-based ransomware strain named 'Milkyway' has been identified by researchers at CYFIRMA. Currently in a developing state, the malware encrypts files and appends a '.milkyway' extension. It employs aggressive extortion tactics via a full-screen ransom note, threatening not only to leak or sell stolen data but also to report victims to tax authorities and law enforcement if the ransom is not paid. The operators also threaten to contact the victim's clients and partners. Experts warn that Milkyway could evolve into a more sophisticated threat, potentially adopting a Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) model, which would significantly broaden its impact.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers have identified a new ransomware strain called 'Milkyway' that uses aggressive extortion tactics, including threats to report victims to authorities, and may evolve into a RaaS platform.

Article Slug: new-milkyway-ransomware-strain-emerges-with-aggressive-extortion-tactics

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Stealthy 'Pulsar RAT' Campaign Uses Living-off-the-Land and In-Memory Execution
item.description:
Headline: Stealthy 'Pulsar RAT' Campaign Uses Living-off-the-Land and In-Memory Execution

Summary:
A highly covert malware campaign is distributing a new modular backdoor and information stealer named 'Pulsar RAT'. The malware is notable for its extensive use of 'living-off-the-land' (LotL) techniques to evade detection. The infection chain uses a batch file to establish persistence via a Run registry key, then uses PowerShell to inject shellcode directly into the memory of legitimate processes like 'explorer.exe'. This fileless, in-memory execution makes it difficult for traditional antivirus to detect. The final .NET-based payload can harvest credentials, perform surveillance via webcam and microphone, and exfiltrate data using common services like Discord and Telegram.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A new stealthy malware campaign is distributing Pulsar RAT, a modular backdoor that uses living-off-the-land techniques and in-memory execution to evade detection and steal sensitive information.

Article Slug: stealthy-pulsar-rat-malware-campaign-uses-living-off-the-land-techniques

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Everest Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Japanese Manufacturer Hosokawa Micron
item.description:
Headline: Everest Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Japanese Manufacturer Hosokawa Micron

Summary:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Hosokawa Micron Corporation, a leading Japanese manufacturer of industrial processing technology. The group announced the breach on an underground forum, threatening to publish approximately 30 GB of exfiltrated confidential company data if their ransom demands are not met. This incident aligns with Everest's typical double-extortion strategy. The group is known for targeting organizations in manufacturing, finance, and IT across the U.S., Europe, and Asia, and also acts as an initial access broker, selling network access to other threat actors.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Everest ransomware group claims a cyberattack on Japanese manufacturer Hosokawa Micron Corporation, threatening to leak 30 GB of stolen data in a double-extortion scheme.

Article Slug: everest-ransomware-group-attacks-japanese-manufacturer-hosokawa-micron

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Substack Discloses Data Breach Exposing User Contact Information
item.description:
Headline: Substack Discloses Data Breach Exposing User Contact Information

Summary:
The newsletter platform Substack has announced it suffered a data breach after discovering on February 3, 2026, that an unauthorized party had gained access to a database containing user information. The exposed data includes names, email addresses, phone numbers, and Stripe IDs, though the company stated that financial data like credit card numbers and passwords were not compromised. The data exposure may date back to October 2025. With over 20 million active users, Substack is warning customers to be wary of suspicious emails and text messages, as a hacker has claimed to have stolen data from 700,000 users and posted it on the dark web.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Newsletter platform Substack confirms a data breach that exposed user information including names, email addresses, and phone numbers. Passwords and financial data were not affected.

Article Slug: substack-discloses-data-breach-exposing-user-contact-information

Published Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 06 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: APT28 Exploits Office Zero-Day in Under 24 Hours, Targets European Governments
item.description:
Headline: APT28 Exploits Office Zero-Day in Under 24 Hours, Targets European Governments

Summary:
The Russian state-sponsored threat group APT28, also known as Fancy Bear, has launched a sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign targeting military, government, and transportation organizations across Europe. Within 24 hours of its public disclosure, the group began exploiting a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Microsoft Office, CVE-2026-21509. The attack utilizes spear-phishing emails with weaponized documents that, upon opening, initiate a multi-stage infection chain. This chain deploys custom malware, including the 'NotDoor' backdoor and 'BeardShell' implant, while leveraging legitimate cloud services like filen.io for command-and-control to evade detection.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Threat Actor, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Analysis of APT28's rapid exploitation of Microsoft Office vulnerability CVE-2026-21509 against European governments, detailing the spear-phishing campaign, malware used, and cloud-based C2 infrastructure.

Article Slug: apt28-exploits-office-zero-day-cve-2026-21509-targets-european-governments

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical N8N Flaws Expose Over 100,000 Automation Servers to RCE Takeover
item.description:
Headline: Critical N8N Flaws Expose Over 100,000 Automation Servers to RCE Takeover

Summary:
Three critical vulnerabilities have been discovered in the popular N8N workflow automation platform, with the most severe, CVE-2026-21858, rated at a CVSS score of 10.0. This 'Ni8mare' flaw allows for unauthenticated remote code execution, enabling attackers to gain complete control of a vulnerable server. At the time of disclosure, over 100,000 internet-facing instances were exposed, and despite patching efforts, nearly 40,000 remain vulnerable. With public proof-of-concept exploits circulating, administrators are urged to upgrade to version 1.121.0 or later immediately, as no effective workarounds exist.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Details on critical vulnerabilities in the N8N workflow automation platform, including CVE-2026-21858, a CVSS 10.0 RCE flaw, affecting over 100,000 servers.

Article Slug: critical-n8n-vulnerabilities-expose-servers-to-rce-cve-2026-21858

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ShinyHunters Breaches Harvard, Exposing Sensitive Alumni and Donor Data via Vishing
item.description:
Headline: ShinyHunters Breaches Harvard, Exposing Sensitive Alumni and Donor Data via Vishing

Summary:
The notorious cybercriminal group ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for a significant data breach at Harvard University's Alumni Affairs and Development (AAD) department. The attack resulted in the exfiltration of approximately 115,000 sensitive records containing personal and financial details of the university's donors. Security analysts believe the breach was executed via a sophisticated voice-phishing (vishing) campaign, where attackers impersonated IT support to trick an employee into providing credentials and MFA tokens on a malicious single sign-on (SSO) portal. This incident highlights the growing threat of identity-based social engineering attacks against high-profile institutions.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Details of the Harvard University data breach by the ShinyHunters group, which exposed 115,000 sensitive donor records through a suspected voice-phishing (vishing) campaign.

Article Slug: shinyhunters-breaches-harvard-university-exposing-donor-data-via-vishing

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cisco and F5 Release Urgent Patches for High-Severity DoS and RCE Vulnerabilities
item.description:
Headline: Cisco and F5 Release Urgent Patches for High-Severity DoS and RCE Vulnerabilities

Summary:
Networking giants Cisco and F5 have released a wave of security updates to address multiple high-severity vulnerabilities across their product lines. Cisco patched five flaws, including a remote DoS bug in TelePresence/RoomOS (CVE-2026-20119) and a root-level command execution flaw in Meeting Management software (CVE-2026-20098). Concurrently, F5 addressed five vulnerabilities in its BIG-IP and NGINX products, two of which are rated high-severity: a DoS flaw in BIG-IP (CVE-2026-22548) and a man-in-the-middle vulnerability in NGINX (CVE-2026-1642). Customers are strongly advised to apply the patches promptly to mitigate risks of service disruption and system compromise.

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Cisco and F5 have released security updates for high-severity vulnerabilities (CVE-2026-20119, CVE-2026-20098, CVE-2026-22548, CVE-2026-1642) affecting their networking products.

Article Slug: cisco-f5-release-patches-for-high-severity-dos-rce-flaws

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Black Basta Ransomware Evolves, Bundles Evasion Tool to Disable Security Software
item.description:
Headline: Black Basta Ransomware Evolves, Bundles Evasion Tool to Disable Security Software

Summary:
The Black Basta ransomware group, also tracked as Cardinal, has significantly enhanced its attack methodology by embedding a defense evasion tool directly into its ransomware payload. This new variant utilizes a 'bring-your-own-vulnerable-driver' (BYOVD) technique, bundling a legitimate but vulnerable NsecSoft NSecKrnl driver to elevate privileges and terminate endpoint security processes. This self-contained approach streamlines the attack chain, making it more efficient and harder to detect compared to previous methods where evasion tools were deployed separately. The development signals a potential resurgence in activity from this major ransomware player.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Analysis of the Black Basta ransomware group's new tactic of embedding a 'bring-your-own-vulnerable-driver' (BYOVD) component to disable endpoint security software.

Article Slug: black-basta-ransomware-evolves-with-embedded-byovd-evasion

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Chinese APT 'Amaranth-Dragon' Hits Southeast Asian Governments with WinRAR Exploit
item.description:
Headline: Chinese APT 'Amaranth-Dragon' Hits Southeast Asian Governments with WinRAR Exploit

Summary:
A newly identified China-linked APT group, dubbed 'Amaranth-Dragon,' is conducting targeted cyber espionage campaigns against government and law enforcement agencies in Southeast Asia. The group, believed to be affiliated with the broader APT41 ecosystem, is exploiting a known WinRAR vulnerability (CVE-2025-8088) for initial access. Amaranth-Dragon demonstrates a high degree of stealth, using custom tools like 'Amaranth Loader' and a new 'TGAmaranth RAT' that leverages Telegram for command-and-control. The campaigns are tightly scoped, targeting countries like Cambodia, Thailand, and the Philippines, and appear to be motivated by geopolitical intelligence gathering.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new China-linked APT group, Amaranth-Dragon, is exploiting a WinRAR vulnerability (CVE-2025-8088) in targeted cyber espionage campaigns against government entities in Southeast Asia.

Article Slug: china-linked-amaranth-dragon-targets-southeast-asian-governments-with-winrar-exploit

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Voicemail-Themed Phishing Campaign Deploys Legitimate RMM Tools for Backdoor Access
item.description:
Headline: Voicemail-Themed Phishing Campaign Deploys Legitimate RMM Tools for Backdoor Access

Summary:
A widespread social engineering campaign is using convincing voicemail-themed lures to trick victims into installing legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software. The attack begins with an email, often from a bank-themed subdomain, leading to a webpage that prompts the user to 'listen to your message.' Instead of playing a message, the page guides the user through a series of installation steps for a legitimate tool called 'Remotely RMM.' Once installed, the software enrolls the device into an attacker-controlled environment, providing them with persistent remote access for data theft and further malware deployment.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A social engineering campaign uses voicemail-themed phishing lures to trick victims into installing legitimate remote monitoring and management (RMM) software for backdoor access.

Article Slug: voicemail-themed-phishing-campaign-deploys-remote-access-tools

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Mandates TLS 1.2 for Azure Blob Storage, Sunsetting Older Versions
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Mandates TLS 1.2 for Azure Blob Storage, Sunsetting Older Versions

Summary:
Microsoft has officially deprecated support for Transport Layer Security (TLS) versions 1.0 and 1.1 for its Azure Blob Storage service, effective February 3, 2026. TLS 1.2 is now the minimum required version for all new and existing blob storage accounts across all Azure clouds. This mandatory security enhancement aims to protect data in transit from known cryptographic vulnerabilities present in the older protocols. Customers with applications or clients still relying on TLS 1.0 or 1.1 must update them to ensure continued connectivity and avoid service disruptions.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 3 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft has mandated TLS 1.2 as the minimum required version for Azure Blob Storage as of February 3, 2026, deprecating support for TLS 1.0 and 1.1 to enhance security.

Article Slug: microsoft-enforces-tls-1-2-for-azure-blob-storage

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Adds Actively Exploited SolarWinds RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog
item.description:
Headline: CISA Adds Actively Exploited SolarWinds RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in SolarWinds Web Help Desk (WHD) to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-40551 with a CVSS score of 9.8, is a deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability. Its inclusion in the KEV catalog serves as a definitive warning that the vulnerability is being actively exploited in the wild. CISA has mandated that all Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies must patch this flaw by February 6, 2026, and all organizations using the product are strongly urged to do the same.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Regulatory

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: CISA has added a critical, actively exploited RCE vulnerability in SolarWinds Web Help Desk (CVE-2025-40551) to its KEV catalog, mandating federal agencies to patch immediately.

Article Slug: cisa-adds-actively-exploited-solarwinds-whd-flaw-to-kev-catalog

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK's Cyber Resilience Bill Moves Forward, ICO Calls for Clarity for SMBs
item.description:
Headline: UK's Cyber Resilience Bill Moves Forward, ICO Calls for Clarity for SMBs

Summary:
The United Kingdom's new Cyber Security and Resilience (Network and Information Systems) Bill has passed its second reading in the House of Commons, moving a step closer to becoming law. The bill aims to strengthen the cyber resilience of the UK's critical network and information systems. In response, the UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) has expressed support for the bill's objectives but has called for the final regulations to provide clear, practical guidance, particularly for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), to ensure they can meet the new requirements without undue burden.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 3 minutes

item.title: NEW: 'Shadow Campaign' Hacks Governments in 37 Countries, China-Linked Group Suspected
item.description:
Headline: 'Shadow Campaign' Hacks Governments in 37 Countries, China-Linked Group Suspected

Summary:
Security researchers have uncovered a massive, long-running cyber-espionage operation dubbed 'Shadow Campaign.' The campaign is attributed to a suspected Chinese nation-state group, TGR-STA-1030, and has successfully compromised at least 70 government and critical infrastructure organizations in 37 countries. The group's reconnaissance activities have been even broader, targeting government infrastructure in 155 countries. Targets include high-value entities like national law enforcement, border control, finance ministries, and telecommunications companies. The operational footprint, including tools and timezone activity (GMT+8), strongly points towards a China-based actor.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A massive cyber-espionage operation, 'Shadow Campaign,' attributed to a suspected Chinese APT group (TGR-STA-1030), has compromised at least 70 government and critical infrastructure organizations in 37 countries.

Article Slug: shadow-campaign-espionage-activity-uncovered-china-suspected

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Futile Ransom: Nitrogen Ransomware Contains Fatal Coding Error, Decryption Impossible
item.description:
Headline: Futile Ransom: Nitrogen Ransomware Contains Fatal Coding Error, Decryption Impossible

Summary:
In a case of profound operational failure, security researchers have discovered a fatal coding error in the Nitrogen ransomware group's malware that targets VMware ESXi systems. The flaw, found in the encryption routine, causes the malware to use the wrong public key during the encryption process. As a result, the decryptor provided by the gang after a ransom is paid is mathematically incapable of reversing the encryption. This means that any victim who pays the ransom for their encrypted ESXi virtual machines has zero chance of recovering their data, reinforcing law enforcement advice to not pay ransoms.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A fatal coding error in the Nitrogen ransomware group's ESXi encryptor makes it impossible for the attackers to decrypt victim files, meaning any ransom paid is wasted.

Article Slug: nitrogen-ransomware-esxi-encryptor-contains-fatal-coding-error

Published Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 05 Feb 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: UK Advances New Bill to Regulate Managed Service Providers (MSPs)
item.description:
Headline: UK Advances New Bill to Regulate Managed Service Providers (MSPs)

Summary:
The United Kingdom government is advancing a new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill aimed at strengthening the nation's digital supply chain. A key provision of the bill is to bring Managed Service Providers (MSPs) under direct regulatory oversight for the first time. Citing the systemic risk demonstrated by attacks like the one on Synnovis that impacted the NHS, the legislation will impose security duties on MSPs similar to those already applied to essential services. The goal is to establish a higher baseline of security across the thousands of organizations that rely on MSPs for their IT and security operations.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The UK's proposed Cyber Security and Resilience Bill aims to bring Managed Service Providers (MSPs) under direct regulatory control to improve national supply-chain security.

Article Slug: uk-proposes-cyber-security-and-resilience-bill-to-regulate-msps

item.title: UPDATE: SolarWinds Discloses Five Critical RCE & Auth Bypass Flaws in Web Help Desk
item.description:
Headline: SolarWinds Discloses Five Critical RCE & Auth Bypass Flaws in Web Help Desk

Summary:
SolarWinds has disclosed a set of five critical vulnerabilities in its Web Help Desk (WHD) platform, a tool used by over 300,000 organizations. The flaws include two unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities and two authentication bypasses, each with a CVSS score of 9.8. This incident highlights a troubling pattern of recurring patch failures, as one of the new flaws, CVE-2025-40553, is the second bypass of an original deserialization vulnerability (CVE-2024-28986) first patched in 2024. Given the critical nature of the flaws, organizations with internet-facing WHD instances are at extreme risk and must patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: SolarWinds has disclosed five critical vulnerabilities in its Web Help Desk (WHD) platform, including RCE and auth bypass flaws with 9.8 CVSS scores. Learn about the risks and the history of failed patches.

Article Slug: solarwinds-discloses-five-critical-flaws-in-web-help-desk-platform
